Package gui

Class MainController

java.lang.Object
gui.MainController
public class MainController
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    MainController()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String addExtension​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String extension)
    Helper method which checks the filepath to check if it has the correct extension and adds it if it does not This stops the user from exporting to a file without an extension if they don't type the extension in the file name.
    void analyseCrimeLocationDifference()
    Forwards the request to analyse the crime locations to the table tab controller
    void analyseCrimeTimeDifference()
    Forwards the request to analyse the crime times to the table tab controller
    void analysisTabClick()
    Keeps track of the number of times the analysis tab has been clicked on/off of, and updates the tables if the tab has just been clicked on to
    void applyFilters()
    Applies all currently selected filters
    void changeDatabase()
    Opens the file explorer for the user to select a save location and then passes this to the database path method which will change the static variable path in database which is accessed every time the database is connected to
    void checkSliderUnlock()
    Enables slider if lat and long are valid in the filter
    void clearFilters()
    Sets all filter parameters back to default
    void displayInvalid​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> invalid)
    Creates a pop-up window which displays the number of invalid rows
    void exportCsv()
    Opens the file explorer for the user to select a save location and then passes this to the CsvWriter along with the currently displayed records.
    void filterSetup()
    Sets up combo boxes in filter pane Sets filter pane as expanded
    void generateGraph()
    Checks that there is enough data in the table to create a graph, then checks if the user has selected the "All Crimes" option.
    java.lang.String getFileSavePath​(java.lang.String fileType, java.lang.String fileExtension)
    Opens the file explorer for the user to select a location to save the selected file, then returns the selected location.
    java.lang.String getPathToFile​(java.lang.String fileType, java.lang.String fileExtension)
    Opens file explorer for user to select a file
    void graphSetup()
    Sets up combo boxes in the graph pane
    void importCsv()
    Opens a file explorer for the user to select csv file to import then loads it
    java.lang.Boolean matchFileType​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String extension)
    Checks if the inputted filepath's extension matches the required extension, this stops the user from importing data from incorrect file types
    java.lang.Boolean newDatabase()
    Prompts the user to select a location to save the new database file, then creates a database file there
    void showGraphPane()
    Displays the graph pane on the sidebar if the user has clicked on the graph tab, otherwise it displays the filter pane
    void updateGraphOptions()
    Clears the checks in the graph filter combo box, then checks what graphing option has been selected and displays the relevant objects, and loads the crime types/wards/beats into the graph filter combo box
    void updateLatLong​(Record record)
    Updates latitude and longitude field in filter sidebar to lat and long of record object
    void updateRadiusText()
    Updates label for radius when slider is updated

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • graphSetup

      public void graphSetup()
      Sets up combo boxes in the graph pane

    • updateGraphOptions

      public void updateGraphOptions() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Clears the checks in the graph filter combo box, then checks what graphing option has been selected and displays the relevant objects, and loads the crime types/wards/beats into the graph filter combo box
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • showGraphPane

      public void showGraphPane()
      Displays the graph pane on the sidebar if the user has clicked on the graph tab, otherwise it displays the filter pane

    • generateGraph

      public void generateGraph()
      Checks that there is enough data in the table to create a graph, then checks if the user has selected the "All Crimes" option. If so, it generates the graph. Then checks that the user has selected a valid number of crime type/ward/beat options. If so, it creates a list of the checked options and then creates the requested graph

    • updateRadiusText

      public void updateRadiusText()
      Updates label for radius when slider is updated

    • applyFilters

      public void applyFilters() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Applies all currently selected filters
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • updateLatLong

      public void updateLatLong​(Record record)
      Updates latitude and longitude field in filter sidebar to lat and long of record object
      Parameters:
      record - Record selected

    • checkSliderUnlock

      public void checkSliderUnlock()
      Enables slider if lat and long are valid in the filter

      public void clearFilters() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Sets all filter parameters back to default
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • getPathToFile

      public java.lang.String getPathToFile​(java.lang.String fileType, java.lang.String fileExtension)
      Opens file explorer for user to select a file
      Parameters:
      fileType - Type of file
      fileExtension - Extension of file
      Returns:
      path to csv file

    • getFileSavePath

      public java.lang.String getFileSavePath​(java.lang.String fileType, java.lang.String fileExtension)
      Opens the file explorer for the user to select a location to save the selected file, then returns the selected location.
      Parameters:
      fileType - The type of file to be saved (CSV or Database)
      fileExtension - The extension of the file to be saved (.csv or .db)
      Returns:
      The file path to the location the user selects

    • exportCsv

      public void exportCsv() throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Opens the file explorer for the user to select a save location and then passes this to the CsvWriter along with the currently displayed records.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.NullPointerException

    • changeDatabase

      public void changeDatabase() throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      Opens the file explorer for the user to select a save location and then passes this to the database path method which will change the static variable path in database which is accessed every time the database is connected to
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.sql.SQLException

    • newDatabase

      public java.lang.Boolean newDatabase() throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.sql.SQLException, java.io.IOException
      Prompts the user to select a location to save the new database file, then creates a database file there
      Returns:
      Boolean true/false if the database was created successfully
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException
      java.sql.SQLException
      java.io.IOException

    • addExtension

      public java.lang.String addExtension​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String extension)
      Helper method which checks the filepath to check if it has the correct extension and adds it if it does not This stops the user from exporting to a file without an extension if they don't type the extension in the file name.
      Parameters:
      path - file path
      extension - correct extension
      Returns:
      filepath or filepath with appended extension

    • matchFileType

      public java.lang.Boolean matchFileType​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String extension)
      Checks if the inputted filepath's extension matches the required extension, this stops the user from importing data from incorrect file types
      Parameters:
      path - file path
      extension - correct extension
      Returns:
      true if file type incorrect
